TITLE.P: Evaluation of Norsk Tipping's and Norsk Rikstoto's Organisation and Practice

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Ministry of Culture hereby invites tenderers to a tender contest for a report assignment regarding the evaluation of Norsk Tipping's and Norsk Rikstoto's organisation and practice. The objective of the evaluation is to look at how Norsk Tipping and Norsk Rikstoto can achieve the goal on reducing negative social consequences in the best possible manner.

In connection with the discussion of the Report to the Storting no. 12 (2016-2017) "Alt å vinne – Ein ansvarleg og aktiv pengespelpolitikk" ("Everything to gain — A reliable and active money games policy") (the money games report), the Storting approved the following petition resolution:

"The Storting is asking the Norwegian Government, in connection with the work on preparing a new law for the money games area, to conduct a broad and external evaluation of Norsk Tipping's and Norsk Rikstoto's organisation and practice, and to look at how the goal for reducing negative social consequences in the best possible manner can be achieved. Including an assessment of the companies' games portfolio and whether or not the current marketing and other media exposure practice can be justified by channelling considerations".

Based on this information, the Ministry of Culture hereby invites tenders to a tender contest for a report assignment regarding the evaluation of Norsk Tipping's and Norsk Rikstoto's organisation and practice. The objective of the evaluation is to look at how the goal for reducing negative social consequences in the best possible manner can be achieved for the participants with exclusive rights.
For further description of the assignment, see annex 1 to the contract (the client's description of the assignment).
The upper financial limit for the contract is NOK 1.2 million excluding VAT.
The report shall be presented by 15 June 2018, at the latest.

SUITABILITY.P: — Certificate, not older than 6 months, confirming that the tenderer has fulfilled his tax, social security and VAT obligations. The certificate can be ordered and obtained from Altinn from the separate link on skatteetaten.no. If this is not possible, it can be ordered from the tax collector or the Norwegian Tax Administration. The certificate is electronically certified and is therefore not signed. For further information, see skatteetaten.no. The certificate shall be enclosed with the tender in accordance with the outline given in the tender documents,
— Foreign tenderers must submit certificates from authorities equivalent to the Norwegian authorities.
— Foreign companies: proof that the company is registered in a trade or business register as prescribed by the law of the country in which the service provider is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The tenderer must have sufficient economic and financial capacity to carry out the delivery, in which, amongst other things, being creditworthy without any requirement for collateral will be adequate.
A credit rating with key figures from a certified credit assessment company or other form of documentation to demonstrate that the requirement has been met.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Tenderers must have carried out at least 3 deliveries in the last 3 years with relevance for this assignment. Relevant assignments are in this context defined as providing reports/evaluations to the public sector. The assignments shall be of corresponding scope.

An overview of the most important deliveries of goods or services that the tenderer has carried out in the last 3 years, together with information on the contract´s value, delivery date or execution and the name of the recipient.
